comments.author: kritua
comments.body:
If I get everything right, your code should look like this:

        print("---=== IPC Temperature Analyzer ===---") 
        NUMS = 3 
        for x in range(NUMS): 
            inputValid = False 
            while not inputValid:    
                a = int(input(f"Enter the high value for day {x}: ")) 
                b = int(input(f"Enter the low value for day {x}: ")) 
                if a > b and a < 40 and b > -40: 
                    inputValid = True
                    continue
            print("Incorrect values, temperatures must be in the range -40 to 40, high must be greater than low.")

`for x in range(NUMS):` will get 3 pairs of temperatures from user. Its equals to `for x in range(1, NUMS+1):` but looks better.

Next we make a while cycle, making user to enter high and low temperatures while he won't enter correct parameters

`if a > b and a < 40 and b > -40:` \- checks input and if its correct, sets `inputValid` flag to True and this will break `while` cycle. If `a > b and a < 40 and b > -40` is False, we print "Incorrect values..." message and retry to get correct values from user.
